https://rpy2.github.io/

https://rviews.rstudio.com/2022/05/25/calling-r-from-python-with-rpy2/

https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/integration/python_r.html

installing rpy2

pip install rpy2
pip install rpy2-arrow

installing pyarrow

conda install pyarrow
conda install pandas

Check my pyarrow

# python
import sys
print(sys.version)
print(sys.executable)
3.9.12 (main, Apr  5 2022, 06:56:58) 
[GCC 7.5.0]
/home/danielle/miniconda3/bin/python
# python
import pyarrow

'8.0.0'

Panda to Arrow Table

https://cdhrdatasys.anu.edu.au/tobecontinued/

import pandas
pandas.__version__
'1.4.3'
fiction = pandas.read_csv("newspaper-fiction.csv", low_memory = False)
fiction.head()

pyarrow_fiction = pyarrow.Table.from_pandas(fiction)

Introducing rpy2

import rpy2.robjects as robjects
from rpy2.robjects.packages import importr, data

R version 4.2.1 (2022-06-23)

üåà
base = importr('base')
base.R_version_string
StrVector with 1 elements.
'R version 4.2.1 (2022-06-23)'

Passing Tables from Python to R

https://rpy2.github.io/rpy2-arrow/version/main/html/index.html

import rpy2_arrow.pyarrow_rarrow as pyra

rarrow_fiction = pyra.pyarrow_to_r_table(pyarrow_fiction)
rarrow_fiction
<rpy2.robjects.environments.Environment object at 0x7f55ed64f640> [RTYPES.ENVSXP]
R classes: ('Table', 'ArrowTabular', 'ArrowObject', 'R6')
n items: 36

Calling R code

%load_ext rpy2.ipython
%%R
suppressMessages({
  library(dplyr)
  library(arrow)
})
%%R -i rarrow_fiction
gender <- rarrow_fiction |> 
  count(Gender) |>
  compute()
  
gender
Table
6 rows x 2 columns
$Gender <string>
$n <int64>

See $metadata for additional Schema metadata

Passing Tables from R to Python

import rpy2.robjects as robjects
r_gender = robjects.r('gender')
r_gender
<rpy2.robjects.environments.Environment object at 0x7f55f88ff4c0> [RTYPES.ENVSXP]
R classes: ('Table', 'ArrowTabular', 'ArrowObject', 'R6')
n items: 36
py_gender = pyra.rarrow_to_py_table(r_gender)
py_gender
pyarrow.Table
Gender: string
n: int64
----
Gender: [["Male","Female","Unknown","Both","Multiple",null]]
n: [[11299,6878,15083,106,176,31]]

Back to Pandas

panda_gender = pyarrow.Table.to_pandas(py_gender)
panda_gender
Gender n
0 Male 11299
1 Female 6878
2 Unknown 15083
3 Both 106
4 Multiple 176
5 None 31
